intro: Roebuckiella cheilocarpa var. cheilocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved roebuckiella, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, aromatic leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbels. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in regions with a Mediterranean climate. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in suitable climates.
